body_html:
@shlens Can you comment? Ages ago we stripped most of these image preprocessing ops down to 3-D only; what do you think about people raising them back up again?

@cancan101 The motivation for 3-D only is that image processing pipelines that take images of different sizes have to handle separate images as separate tensors anyways, at least until after the resizing step happens. And this op is the resizing step.

body:
@shlens Can you comment?  Ages ago we stripped most of these image preprocessing ops down to 3-D only; what do you think about people raising them back up again?

@cancan101 The motivation for 3-D only is that image processing pipelines that take images of different sizes have to handle separate images as separate tensors anyways, at least until after the resizing step happens.  And this op is the resizing step.
